element.name: Trauma Center Criteria
element.definition: Field Triage Criteria for transport to a trauma center as defined by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the American College of Surgeons-Committee on Trauma.
element.v3Comment: 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients - value choices for Steps 1 and 2. For falls, one story is equal to 10 feet.
element.v3Changes:
Added to better evaluate the CDC-ACS 2011 Guidelines for the Field Triage of Injured Patients.
Website: http://www.cdc.gov/FieldTriage/

choice.description: Amputation proximal to wrist or ankle
Crushed, degloved, mangled, or pulseless extremity
Chest wall instability or deformity (e.g., flail chest)
All penetrating injuries to head, neck, torso, and extremities proximal to elbow or knee
Respiratory Rate <10 or >29 breaths per minute (<20 in infants aged <1 year) or need for ventilatory support
Two or more proximal long-bone fractures
